sen.j: 京都市制以前の明治12年（1879年）、京都府に「上京区」「下京区」が設置された。

tit.j: 通り名を用いた住所表示
tit.e: Indication of residential address by the use of street names
tit.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
tit.e: Indication of residential address by the use of street names

sen.j: 日本における住所表示は、建物の面している道路名ではなく、建物が所在する町や字（あざ）の名をもって表記されるのが普通であるが、京都の市街地においては例外的に「通り名」を用いた住所表示が行われている。
sen.e: In Japan, addresses are usually indicated using the names of the town and aza (section of village) in which the building is located instead of street names, but in urban district of Kyoto, addresses are exceptionally indicated using 'street names'.

Indication of residential address in Japan is usually expressed not by the street names which the building faces, but are expressed by the name of the town or aza (an administrative designation of small sections into which some of the rural districts of Japan are divided) where the building is located; however, indication of residential address with 'street names' is used exceptionally for the urban area of Kyoto.
sen.cmt: which→ where と変更しました。他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Indication of residential address in Japan is usually expressed not by the street names which the building faces, but are expressed by the name of the town or aza (an administrative designation of small sections into which some of the rural districts of Japan are divided) where the building is located; however, indication of residential address with 'street names' is used exceptionally for the urban area of Kyoto.

sen.j: この方式では、まず、家屋、ビルなどが直接面している通りの名を先に言い、その後に直近で交差する通りの名を付記し、「上る」（あがる）、「下る」（さがる）、「東入」（ひがしいる）、「西入」（にしいる）等と表記する。
sen.e: According to this method, the name of the street on which the building directly faces comes first, then the nearest crossing street comes next, followed by 'agaru' (up), 'sagaru' (down), 'higashi iru' (to the east), or 'nishi iru' (to the west), etc.

According to this method, the street name which a house or a building directly faces is being mentioned first, and then a name of an intersecting street in the nearest area is added, followed by the expressions such as 'Agaru' (to the north of), 'Sagaru' (to the south of), 'Higashiiru' (to the east of) and 'Nishiiru' (to the west of).
sen.cmt: 下がる→to the south of に修正しました。他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: According to this method, the street name which a house or a building directly faces is being mentioned first, and then a name of an intersecting street in the nearest area is added, followed by the expressions such as 'Agaru' (to the north of), 'Sagaru' (to the south of), 'Higashiiru' (to the east of) and 'Nishiiru' (to the west of).

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部を小文字に変更しました。

sen.j: 京都市内の町名には「大原来迎院町」のように旧村名、旧大字名に由来する地名（上記例の場合は「大原」）を冠称するものと、「亀屋町」「菊屋町」のような単独町名とがある。
sen.e: The Town Names of Kyoto City are categorized into those using their former village names or former Oaza (large section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-Cho' (in this case, 'Ohara' is former name) and those using an independent name of a town such as 'Kameya-Cho' and 'Kikuya-Cho'.

sen.j: 下京区においては区の東部の町名はすべて単独町名であり、西部は「中堂寺」「西七条」などの旧村名を冠した町名となっている。
sen.e: All town names in the east part of the Shimogyo Ward are independent names, and in the west part, town names are prefixed by former village names such as 'Chudoji' or 'Nishi-shichijo'.

sen.j: 区内の公称町名の数は、『角川日本地名大辞典 26 京都府』下巻によれば511町（1980年現在）である。
sen.e: According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture), there were officially 511 declared towns in 1980.

According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture), there were officially 511 declared towns as of 1980.

sen.j: なお、「大宮一、二、三丁目」「天使突抜一、二、三、四丁目」「突抜一、二丁目」の「丁目」を各1町と数えた場合は6町増えて517町となる。
sen.e: If you count 'Omiya 1, 2, and 3 chome', 'Tenshitsukinuke 1, 2, 3, and 4 chome', and 'Tsukinuke 1 and 2 chome' independently, the number is 517, increased by 6.
If you count '1, 2, and 3-chome Omiya', '1, 2, 3, and 4-chome Tenshitsukinuke', and '1 and 2-chome Tsukinuke' independently, the number is 517, increased by 6.

sen.j: 京都市においては「住居表示に関する法律」に基づく住居表示は実施されておらず、市内の公称町名については、「京都市区の所管区域条例」（昭和24年4月1日京都市条例第7号）が根拠となっている。
sen.e: In Kyoto City, address indication based on 'Act on Indication of Residential Address' is not enforced, but 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts in Kyoto City' (7th Kyoto City Ordinance, April 1, 1949) gives the basis of official town names in Kyoto City.

Indication of residential address based on 'Act on Indication of Residential Address' is not implemented in Kyoto City, and the official town names within the city are based on 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts of Kyoto City' (Act No. 7 of Kyoto Municipal Ordinance, April 1, 1949).
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Indication of residential address based on 'Act on Indication of Residential Address' is not implemented in Kyoto City, and the official town names within the city are based on 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts of Kyoto City' (Act No. 7 of Kyoto Municipal Ordinance, April 1, 1949).

sen.j: 「所管区域条例」に列挙される下京区の町名は『角川日本地名大辞典』のそれとおおむね一致するが、細部には違いがある（「備考」の項を参照）。
sen.e: The town names in Shimogyo Ward listed in 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts' basically match those in "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan), but there are details that are different (see 'Remarks'.)
The town names in Shimogyo Ward listed in 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts' basically match those in "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten," although differing in detail. (See 'Remarks.')
sen.cmt: 角川日本地名大辞典 既出のため、補足説明を削除しました。
sen.e: The town names in Shimogyo Ward listed in 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts' basically match those in "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten," although differing in detail. (See 'Remarks.')

sen.j: 近世には、二条通り以北を上京、以南を下京と称し、上京には「上京十二組」「禁裏六丁組」、下京には「下京八組」という町組（ちょうぐみ）が組織されていた。
sen.e: In the early modern period, north of Nijo-dori Street was called Kamigyo and south was called Shimogyo, and there were Machigumi (town societies) called 'Kamigyo town society No. 12' and 'Kinri Rokucho town society' in Kamigyo and 'Shimogyo Town Society No. Eight' in Shimogyo.

In the early modern Kyoto, the area north of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Kamigyo, and the area south of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Shimogyo; and chogumi (town society) called 'Twelve town societies of Kamigyo' and 'Kinri Rokucho town society' were formed in Kamigyo, and 'Eight town societies of Shimogyo' were formed in Shimogyo.
sen.cmt: areas →the area としました。他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: In the early modern Kyoto, the area north of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Kamigyo, and the area south of Nijo-dori Street was referred to as Shimogyo; and chogumi (town society) called 'Twelve town societies of Kamigyo' and 'Kinri Rokucho town society' were formed in Kamigyo, and 'Eight town societies of Shimogyo' were formed in Shimogyo.

sen.j: 町組は近隣の町の連合体、自治組織であり、その起源は判然としないが、室町時代には存在が確認される。
sen.e: Machigumi were self-governing organizations and unions of towns, and although their origin is not clear, their existence in the Muromachi period is confirmed.
Chogumi was an union of neighboring towns and a self-governing organization, and although its origin is unclear, its existence can be confirmed already in the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Chogumi was an union of neighboring towns and a self-governing organization, and although its origin is unclear, its existence can be confirmed already in the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 明治元年（1868年）、京都府の成立とともに、下京の町組は1 - 41番組に編成されるが、翌明治2年（1869年）には町組改正で下京1 - 32番組に再編成された。
sen.e: In 1868, as Kyoto Prefecture was established, machigumi in Shimogyo was organized into 1 - 41 ban gumi (1 to 41th societies), but they were reorganized into Shimogyo 1 - 32 ban gumi by machigumi reorganization in 1869.

With the establishment of Kyoto Prefecture in 1868, the chogumi of Shimogyo was organized into bangumi (town unit) Nos. 1 to 41, but in the following year in 1869, they were reorganized into Shimogyo bangumi Nos. 1 to 32.
sen.cmt: 町組→chogumi としました。他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: With the establishment of Kyoto Prefecture in 1868, the chogumi of Shimogyo was organized into bangumi (town unit) Nos. 1 to 41, but in the following year in 1869, they were reorganized into Shimogyo bangumi Nos. 1 to 32.

sen.j: 明治5年（1872年）には下京1 - 32番組が下京1 - 32区と改められた。
sen.e: IN 1872, Shimogyo 1- 32 ban gumi were modified to Shimogyo 1-32 Wards.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1872, Shimogyo bangumi Nos. 1 to 32 were reorganized into to Shimogyo ward Nos. 1 to 32.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: In 1872, Shimogyo bangumi Nos. 1 to 32 were reorganized into to Shimogyo ward Nos. 1 to 32.

sen.j: 32に区分される点は変わらないが、旧下京24番組が下京7区と15区に二分され、旧下京22番組と32番組が統合されて下京16区になっている。
sen.e: While the number of groups, 32, was not changed, former Shimogyo 24 ban gumi was divided into Shimogyo 7th Ward and 15th Ward, and former Shimogyo 22 ban gumi and 32 ban gumi were incorporated into Shimogyo 16 Ward.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: While there was no change in terms of dividing Shimogyo into 32, former Shimogyo bangumi No. 24 was divided into Shimogyo wards No. 7 and No. 15, and former Shimogyo bangumi Nos. 22 and 32 were incorporated into Shimogyo ward No. 16.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: While there was no change in terms of dividing Shimogyo into 32, former Shimogyo bangumi No. 24 was divided into Shimogyo wards No. 7 and No. 15, and former Shimogyo bangumi Nos. 22 and 32 were incorporated into Shimogyo ward No. 16.

sen.j: 明治12年（1879年）、京都府に上京区・下京区が設置されると、従来の「区」は、番号はそのままで「組」と改称、下京1 - 32組となる。
sen.e: In 1879, when Kamigyo and Shimogyo Wards were established in Kyoto City, 'wards' at that time were changed to 'kumi' with the numbers unchanged, forming Shimogyo 1-32 kumi.

When Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward were created inside Kyoto Prefecture in 1879, the above-mentioned 'wards' were renamed as 'kumi' without making changes to their numbers, and became Shimogyo kumi Nos. 1 to 32.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: When Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward were created inside Kyoto Prefecture in 1879, the above-mentioned 'wards' were renamed as 'kumi' without making changes to their numbers, and became Shimogyo kumi Nos. 1 to 32.

sen.j: 明治22年（1889年）、京都市制とともに、上京区・下京区は京都市の区となる。
sen.e: In 1889, with the municipal system of Kyoto City, Kamigyo and Shimogyo Wards became wards of Kyoto City.
With the enforcement of Municipal Government Act of Kyoto City in 1889, Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward became the wards of Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 京都市制→Municipal Government Act of Kyoto City とし、他の記事と統一しました。
sen.e: With the enforcement of Municipal Government Act of Kyoto City in 1889, Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward became the wards of Kyoto City.

sen.j: なお、近世と違い、二条通りではなく三条通りが上京・下京の境となっている。
sen.e: Unlike in the modern time, Sanjo-dori Street instead of Nijo-dori Street was the border between Kamigyo and Shimogyo Wards.
Unlike the early-modern times in Kyoto, instead of Nijo-dori Street, Sanjo-dori Street became the border between Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Unlike the early-modern times in Kyoto, instead of Nijo-dori Street, Sanjo-dori Street became the border between Kamigyo Ward and Shimogyo Ward.

sen.j: この間、明治21年には同年下京区に編入された旧愛宕郡の村域に下京33組が設定された。
sen.e: During this period, in 1888, Shimogyo 33 kumi was established in the village area of former Otagi-gun that was incorporated into Shimogyo Ward in the same year.
During this period, in 1888, Shimogyo kumi No. 33 was established in the village area of former Otagi County that was incorporated into Shimogyo Ward in the same year.

sen.e: During this period, in 1888, Shimogyo kumi No. 33 was established in the village area of former Otagi County that was incorporated into Shimogyo Ward in the same year.

sen.j: 明治25年（1892年）には「組」を「学区」に改組。
sen.e: In 1892, 'kumi' was reorganized into 'school district'.
In 1892, 'kumi' was reorganized into 'school district.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドの場所を移動しました。
sen.e: In 1892, 'kumi' was reorganized into 'school district.'

sen.j: 旧下京1 - 32組は、下京第1 - 32学区に編成された。
sen.e: Former Shimogyo 1-32 kumi were reorganized into Shimogyo 1-32 school districts.
Former Shimogyo kumi Nos. 1 to 32 were reorganized into Shimogyo school districts Nos. 1 to 32.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。

sen.j: このうち、第9 - 14、16 - 19、23 - 26、29、30学区の全部と第32学区の一部が現在の下京区に属し、第32学区の南部は南区、残余の学区は中京区及び東山区に属する。
sen.e: All areas of 9-14, 16-19. 23-26, 29, and 30 school districts and part of 32 school district belong to the present Shimogyo Ward, and the southern part of 32 school district belongs to Minami Ward and the rest belongs to Nakagyo and Higashiyama Wards.

sen.j: 昭和4年（1929年）、下京区の一部区域は新設の中京区及び東山区の各一部となった。
sen.e: In 1929, a part of Shimogyo Ward was incorporated into Nakagyo and Higashiyama Wards.

sen.j: 同年、学区名に小学校名を付して「郁文学区」「格致学区」のように称するようになる。
sen.e: In the same year, school district names were prefixed by elementary school names such as 'Ikubun school district' and 'Kakuchi school district'.
In the same year, the names of elementary schools were added to the names of the school districts to be referred to as 'Ikubun school district,' 'Kakuchi school district,' and so on.

sen.j: 昭和16年（1941年）の国民学校令の発布とともに学区制は廃止された。
sen.e: In 1941, as the Kokumin gakko rei (Act of elementary schools) was issued, the school district system was abolished.
With the proclamation of Kokumin gakko rei (Act of elementary schools) in 1941, school district system was abolished.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。

sen.j: したがって、これらの学区は現在では正式の行政区域ではないが、「元学区」という形で、地域の通称としては現在も使われている。
sen.e: Therefore, these school districts are not official administrative district, but they are still used as aliases of areas in the form of 'former school districts.'

sen.j: なお、学校の統廃合等により、元学区と現在の通学区とは一致していない。
sen.e: Due to integration and abolition of schools etc., former school districts and current attendance units do not match.
Meanwhile, due to the integration and abolition of schools, there is no consistency between the old school districts and the present-day attendance units.

sen.e: There were five districts in the Ouchi-mura village Kadono-gun (Chudoji, Suzaku, Hachijo, Higashi Shiokoji, and Nishikujo), among which Higashi Shiokoji was absorbed into Shimogyo Ward in 1902 and the rest were absorbed in 1918 to be organized into 57 towns.

There were five Oaza in the Ouchi village, Kadono County (Chudoji, Suzaku, Hachijo, Higashi Shiokoji, and Nishikujo), among which Higashi Shiokoji was integrated into Shimogyo Ward in 1902 and the rest was incorporated in 1918 to be organized into 57 towns.

sen.j: - この町名は、京都市の各区に属する公称町名を列挙した「京都市区の所管区域条例」（昭和24年4月1日京都市条例第7号）に収録されているが、『角川日本地名大辞典 26 京都府』では昭和35年（1960年）に廃止された旧町名とされている。
sen.e: This town name is in 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts in Kyoto City' (7th Kyoto City Ordinance, April 1, 1949) that lists official town names that belong to Wards in Kyoto City, but according to "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture), it is an abolished old town name.

This town name is in 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts in Kyoto City' (Act No. 7 of Kyoto Municipal Ordinance, April 1, 1949) that lists official town names that belong to Wards in Kyoto City, but according to "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu," it is an old name of a town that was abolished in 1960.
sen.cmt: 角川日本地名大辞典 既出のため、補足説明を削除しました。1960年を追加しました。
sen.e: This town name is in 'Municipal Ordinance of Jurisdiction Districts in Kyoto City' (Act No. 7 of Kyoto Municipal Ordinance, April 1, 1949) that lists official town names that belong to Wards in Kyoto City, but according to "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu," it is an old name of a town that was abolished in 1960.

sen.j: 「梅小路中町」は、下京区における各種選挙の投票区を定めた告示（昭和54年8月30日下京区選管告示第7号）にもみえない。
sen.e: Umekoji Naka machi' is not listed in the announcement that defines election districts of various elections in Shimogyo ward (Seventh Announcement by The Shimogyo Ward Electoral Management Committee, August 30, 1979), either.
